HackerRank Algorithms Part I

Hacker Rank Warmup Problems

Home About Blog Projects Competitions Resume View On GitHub

    Hacker Rank Algorithm Warmup Problems

    As per the FAQ of hacker rank you are allowed to post code of non ongoing contests.

    This blog post provides each of my solutions and their time complexity to the Hacker Rank algorithm warmup problems. I don’t explain my solutions because they are straight foward loops and if statements. In future problems when they become more complex, I will. Most problems were done in C++, C#, java, javascript, python. You’ll notice that most of my code is similar to one another. This is because I solved the problem in one language then afterwards used that same approach with the other languages.

    Simple Array Sum

    Hacker Rank Simple Array Sum

    Github repository

    C++:

    int simpleArraySum(std::vector<int> ar) {
    return std::accumulate(ar.begin(), ar.end(), 0);

}

    C#:

    static int simpleArraySum(int[] ar) {
    return ar.Sum();
}

    Python:

    def simpleArraySum(ar):
    return sum(ar)

    Java:

    static int simpleArraySum(int[] ar) {
    int result = 0;
    for(int number : ar)
        result += number;
    return result;
}

    JavaScript:

    function simpleArraySum(ar) {
    var sum = 0;
    for(var i = 0; i < ar.length; i++)
        sum += ar[i];
    return sum;
}

    Time Complexity: O(n) In each one we are iterating through n elements to create their sum.

    Compare the triplets

    Hacker Rank Compare The Triplets

    Github repository

    C++:

    vector<int> compareTriplets(std::vector<int> a, std::vector<int> b) {
    int alisonScore = 0;
    int bobScore = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < a.size(); i++){
        if(a[i] < b[i])
            bobScore++;
        else if(a[i] > b[i])
            alisonScore++;
    }

    return std::vector<int> {alisonScore, bobScore};
}

    C#

    static List<int> compareTriplets(List<int> a, List<int> b) {
    int alisonScore, bobScore;
    alisonScore = bobScore = 0;

    for(int i = 0; i < a.Count; i++){
        if(a[i] < b[i])
            bobScore++;
        else if(a[i] > b[i])
            alisonScore++;
    }

    return new List<int> {alisonScore, bobScore};
}

    Python

    alisonScore = bobScore = 0
for i in range(0, len(a)):
    if(a[i] < b[i]):
        bobScore += 1
    elif(a[i] > b[i]):
        alisonScore += 1
    
return [alisonScore, bobScore]

    Java:

    static List<Integer> compareTriplets(List<Integer> a, List<Integer> b) {
    int alisonScore, bobScore;
    alisonScore = bobScore = 0;

    for(int i = 0; i < a.size(); i++){
        if(a.get(i) < b.get(i))
            bobScore++;
        else if(a.get(i) > b.get(i))
            alisonScore++;
    }

    return Arrays.asList(alisonScore, bobScore); 
}

    Javascript:

    function compareTriplets(a, b) {
    var alisonScore, bobScore;
    alisonScore = bobScore = 0;

    for(var i = 0; i < a.length; i++){
        if(a[i] < b[i])
            bobScore++;
        else if(a[i] > b[i])
            alisonScore++;
    }

    return new Array (alisonScore, bobScore);

}

    Time Complexity: O(n) In each one we are iterating through n elements comparing each element to another elemeent

    A Very Big Sum

    Hacker Rank A Very Big Sum

    Github repository

    Solutions are virtually identical to the Simple Array Sum problem.

    C++:

    long aVeryBigSum(std::vector<long> ar) {
    return std::accumulate(ar.begin(), ar.end(), (long)0);
}

    C#:

    static long aVeryBigSum(long[] ar) {
    return ar.Sum();

}

    Python:

    def aVeryBigSum(ar):
    return sum(ar)

    Java:

    static long aVeryBigSum(long[] ar) {
    long sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < ar.length; i++)
        sum += ar[i];
    return sum;
}

    Javascript:

    function aVeryBigSum(ar) {
    var sum = 0;
    for(var i = 0; i < ar.length; i++)
        sum += ar[i];
    return sum;
}

    Time Complexity: O(n) iterating through n elements to create their sum.

    Diagonal Difference

    Hacker Rank Diagonal Difference

    Github repository

    C++:

    int diagonalDifference(std::vector<std::vector<int>> arr) {
    int first, second, j = arr.size() - 1;
    first = second = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++, j--){
        first += arr[i][i];
        second += arr[j][i];
    }
    
    return abs(first - second);
}

    C#:

    class Result
{
    public static int diagonalDifference(List<List<int>> arr)
    {
        int first, second, j = arr.Count - 1;
        first = second = 0;
        for(int i = 0; i < arr.Count; i++, j--){
            first += arr[i][i];
            second += arr[j][i];
        }
    
        return Math.Abs(first - second);

    }

}

    Python:

    def diagonalDifference(arr):
    first = second = 0
    j = len(arr) - 1
    for i in range(0, len(arr)):
        first += arr[i][i]
        second += arr[j][i]
        j -= 1
    
    return abs(first - second)

    Java:

    class Result {

    public static int diagonalDifference(List<List<Integer>> arr) {
        int first, second, j = arr.size() - 1;
        first = second = 0;
        for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++, j--){
            first += (arr.get(i)).get(i);
            second += (arr.get(j)).get(i);
        }
    
        return Math.abs(first - second);

    }

}

    Javascript:

    function diagonalDifference(arr) {
    var first, second, j = arr.length - 1;
    first = second = 0;

    for(var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++, j--){
        first += arr[i][i];
        second += arr[j][i];
    }

    return Math.abs(first - second);

}

    Time Complexity: O(n) iterating through n elements to create two different sums.

    Plus Minus

    Hacker Rank Plus Minus

    Github repository

    C++:

    void plusMinus(std::vector<int> arr) {
    double positive, negative, zero;
    positive = negative = zero = 0;

    for(int& number : arr){
        if(number > 0) positive++;
        else if(number < 0) negative++;
        else zero++;
    }

    std::cout << positive / arr.size() << std::endl 
    << negative / arr.size() << std::endl << zero / arr.size();
}

    C#:

    static void plusMinus(int[] arr) {
    double positive, negative, zero;
    positive = negative = zero = 0;

    for(int i = 0; i < arr.Length; i++){
        if(arr[i] > 0) positive++;
        else if(arr[i] < 0) negative++;
        else zero++;
    }
        
    Console.WriteLine(positive / arr.Length + "\n" + negative / arr.Length + "\n" + zero / arr.Length);
}

    Python:

    def plusMinus(arr):
    positive = negative = zero = 0.0

    for i in range(0, len(arr)):
        if arr[i] > 0 : positive += 1
        elif arr[i] < 0 : negative += 1
        else : zero += 1

    print(positive / len(arr), '\n' , negative / len(arr), '\n', zero / len(arr))

    Java:

    static void plusMinus(int[] arr) {
    double positive, negative, zero;
    positive = negative = zero = 0;

    for(int number : arr){
        if(number > 0) positive++;
        else if(number < 0) negative++;
        else zero++;
    }

    System.out.print(positive / arr.length + "\n" + negative / arr.length +"\n" + zero / arr.length);

}

    Javascript

    function plusMinus(arr) {

    var positive, negative, zero;
    positive = negative = zero = 0;
    for(var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++){
        if(arr[i] > 0) positive++;
        else if(arr[i] < 0) negative++;
        else zero++;
    }

    console.log(positive / arr.length + "\n" + negative /arr.length + "\n" + zero / arr.length);

}

    Time Complexity: O(n) iterating through n elements to create the sum of positive, negative and zero numbers.

    Staircase

    Hacker Rank Staircase

    Github repository

    C++:

    void staircase(int n) {
    for(int i = 1; i < n + 1; i++){
        std::string spaces (n - i, ' ');
        std::string hashtag(i, '#');
        std::cout << spaces + hashtag << std::endl;
    }

}

    C#:

    static void staircase(int n) {
    for(int i = 1; i < n + 1; i++){
        string spaces = new String(' ', n - i);
        string hashtag = new String('#', i);
        Console.WriteLine(spaces + hashtag);
    }
}

    Time Complexity: O(n) iterating through n elements to print a string.

    Mini-Max Sum

    Hacker Rank Mini-Max Sum

    Github repository

    C++:

    void miniMaxSum(std::vector<int> arr) {
    long min, max, sum = 0;
    min = max = arr.front();
    for(int& number : arr){
        sum += number;
        if(number < min)
            min = number;
        if(number > max)
            max = number;
    }

    std::cout << sum - max << " " << sum - min << std::endl;
}

    C#:

    static void miniMaxSum(int[] arr) {
    long min, max, sum = 0;
    min = max = arr[0];
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.Length; i++){
        sum += arr[i];
        if(arr[i] < min)
            min = arr[i];
        if(arr[i] > max)
            max = arr[i];
    }

    Console.WriteLine((sum - max) + " " + (sum - min));

}

    Python:

    def miniMaxSum(arr):
    mini, maxi, total = arr[0], arr[0], 0
    for i in range(0, len(arr)) :
        total += arr[i]
        if(arr[i] < mini):
            mini = arr[i]
        if(arr[i] > maxi):
            maxi = arr[i]

    print(total - maxi, total - mini)

    Java:

    static void miniMaxSum(int[] arr) {
    long min, max, sum = 0;
    min = max = arr[0];
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++){
        sum += arr[i];
        if(arr[i] < min)
            min = arr[i];
        if(arr[i] > max)
            max = arr[i];
    }

    System.out.println((sum - max) + " " + (sum - min));

}

    JavaScript

    function miniMaxSum(arr) {
    var min, max, sum = 0;
    min = max = arr[0];

    for(var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++){
        sum += arr[i];
        if(arr[i] < min)
            min = arr[i];
        if(arr[i] > max)
            max = arr[i];
    }

    console.log((sum - max) + " " + (sum - min));

}

    Time Complexity: O(n) iterating through n elements to determine minimum and maximum value.

    Birthday Cake Candles

    Hacker Rank Birthday Cake Candles

    Github repository

    C++:

    int birthdayCakeCandles(vector<int> ar) {
    int sum = 1, height = ar.front();
    for(auto i = ar.begin() + 1 ; i != ar.end(); ++i){
        if(*i > height){
            sum = 0;
            height = *i;
        }
        if(height == *i)
            sum++;
    }
    return sum;

}

    C#:

    static int birthdayCakeCandles(int[] ar) {
    int sum = 1, height = ar[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < ar.Length; i++){
        if(ar[i] > height){
            sum = 0;
            height = ar[i];
        }
        if(height == ar[i])
            sum++;
    }
    return sum;

}

    Python:

    def birthdayCakeCandles(ar):
    total, height = 1, ar[0]

    for i in range(1, len(ar)):
        if ar[i] > height : 
            total = 0
            height = ar[i]
        if height == ar[i] :
            total+= 1

    return total

    Java:

    static int birthdayCakeCandles(int[] ar) {
    int sum = 1, height = ar[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < ar.length; i++){
        if(ar[i] > height){
            sum = 0;
            height = ar[i];
        }
        if(height == ar[i])
            sum++;
    }

    return sum;

}

    Javascript

    function birthdayCakeCandles(ar) {
    var sum = 1, height = ar[0];
    for(var i = 1; i < ar.length; i++){
        if(ar[i] > height){
            sum = 0;
            height = ar[i];
        }
        if(height == ar[i])
            sum++;
    }

    return sum;
}

    Time Complexity: O(n) iterating through n elements to determine the sum of the largest number

    Time Conversion

    Hacker Rank Time Conversion

    Github repository

    C++:

    string timeConversion(string s) {
    string meridian = s.substr(s.size() - 2, s.size());
    string ms = s.substr(2, s.size() - 4);
    int hour = std::stoi(s.substr(0,2));

    hour = ((meridian == "AM" && hour == 12) ? 0 : (meridian == "PM" && hour != 12) ? (hour + 12) : hour);

    return ((hour < 12) ? ('0' + to_string(hour)) : to_string(hour)) + ms;
}

    C#:

    string timeConversion(string s) {
    string meridian = s.substr(s.size() - 2, s.size());
    string ms = s.substr(2, s.size() - 4);
    int hour = std::stoi(s.substr(0,2));

    hour = ((meridian == "AM" && hour == 12) ? 0 : (meridian == "PM" && hour != 12) ? (hour + 12) : hour);

    return ((hour < 12) ? ('0' + to_string(hour)) : to_string(hour)) + ms;
}

    Java:

    static String timeConversion(String s) {
    String meridian = s.substring(s.length() - 2, s.length());
    String ms = s.substring(2, s.length() - 2);
    int hour = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(0,2));

    hour = ((meridian.equals("AM") && hour == 12) ? 0 : (meridian.equals("PM") && hour != 12) ? (hour + 12) : hour);


    return ((hour < 12) ? ("0" + hour) : hour) + ms;

}

    Time Complexity: O(1) no iterating just simple string modifications.

    Explanation of the ternary: The ternary operation that is occuring in the code may look confusing but it’s equivalent to:

    if(meridian == "AM && hour == 12)
    hour = 0;
else{
    if(meridian == PM && hour != 12)
        hour += 12;
    else
        hour;
}
